snippet: An amendment legalizing recreational use in the state starting in 2014 gave towns the power to restrict sales, and some have decided to act pre-emptively.
abstract: Some cities and towns in Colorado are not waiting for state to issue temporary regulations on sale of marijuana, instead deciding to enact moratoriums on retail marijuana sales until after rules are finalized later in 2013.
lead_paragraph: An amendment legalizing recreational use in the state starting in 2014 gave towns the power to restrict sales, and some have decided to act pre-emptively.

headline.main: Colorado Localities Make Own Rules Before Final Decision on Marijuana Sales
headline.print_headline: Decisions About Marijuana Sales Loom for Colorado Localities
